sentences: Marguerite Béclard d'Harcourt (24 February 1884  - 2 August 1964) was a French composer and ethno-musicologist.
She was born in Paris and studied composition at the Schola Cantorum with Abel Decaux, Vincent d'Indy and Maurice Emmanuel.
She also collected and published folk melodies from Ecuador, Peru, Bolivia and other countries in standard European notation.
